newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends at lows on commercial liquidation.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends at lows on commercial liquidation.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended lower and at the day's lows on nearby commercial and commission house long liquidation and locals were net sellers in all months, traders said.

"We fell on hedges, commercial and commission liquidation, locals were net sellers," a trader said. July WCE futures crush profit margin rose to -17.46 Wednesday from -17.48 Tuesday. About 400 July-Nov spread at $49.50, 250 May-Nov $45, 500 May-July $4.80 and 50 July-Aug $12.50. Volume was 5,390 lots.
May canola lost $2.90 to $418.20/tonne, July fell $3.20 at $422.90 and November down $5.10 at $373.40. November flax rose $2.90 to $327.40 on UGG demand, 50 Sep-Nov $0.50, May-July $2.
May western barley fell $0.50 to $139.60 as UGG bought and Alberta Wheat Pool unwound May-July spreads at $0.50, July down $0.30 to $139.30. July-Oct spread at even money. Volume 1,100.
"The collapse in the July-Oct spread is due to the high ending stocks and higher than expected area (in Saskatchewan)," a barley trader said. Oats did not trade.
May feed wheat slipped $1.90 to $170 and July fell $1.40 to $167.50 mainly on spread trades.

UGG bought May-Dec at $5 and AWP sold May-July at $3. Volume 825 lots, traders said. UGG bought May feed pea contracts up US$2 to US$217, October rose US$1 to US$194.50 on UGG demand, a trader said. Volume 150.
(All values in Canadian dollars, except feed peas, oats)
